verses.verse: Now King <S%H4428><s%> Ahasuerus <S%H325><s%> laid <S%H7760><s%> a tribute <S%H4522><s%> on the land <S%H776><s%> and on the coastlands <S%H339><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%>

And all <S%H3605><s%> the accomplishments <S%H4639><s%> of his authority <S%H8633><s%> and strength, <S%H1369><s%> and the full <S%H6575><s%> account <S%H6575><s%> of the greatness <S%H1420><s%> of Mordecai, <S%H4782><s%> to which <S%H834><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> advanced <S%H1431><s%> him, are they not written <S%H3789><s%> in the Book <S%H5612><s%> of the Chronicles <S%H1697><s%> <S%H3117><s%> of the Kings <S%H4428><s%> of Media <S%H4074><s%> and Persia <S%H6539><s%>?

For Mordecai <S%H4782><s%> the Jew <S%H3064><s%> was second <S%H4932><s%> [only] to King <S%H4428><s%> Ahasuerus <S%H325><s%> and great <S%H1419><s%> among the Jews, <S%H3064><s%> and in favor <S%H7521><s%> with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of his kinsmen, <S%H251><s%> one who sought <S%H1875><s%> the good <S%H9185><s%> of his people <S%H5971><s%> and one who spoke <S%H1696><s%> for the welfare <S%H7965><s%> of his whole <S%H3605><s%> nation. <S%H2233><s%>
